id='10_1162_netn_a_00323_abstract_373_1769839751.433402' statement='The Workgroup for HArmonized Taxonomy of NETworks (WHATNET) was formed in 2020 as an Organization for Human Brain Mapping (OHBM)–endorsed best practices committee to provide recommendations on points of consensus, identify open questions, and highlight areas of ongoing debate in the service of moving the field toward standardized reporting of network neuroscience results' paper_id='10_1162_netn_a_00323' evidence=['The Workgroup for HArmonized Taxonomy of NETworks (WHATNET) was formed in 2020 as an Organization for Human Brain Mapping (OHBM)–endorsed best practices committee to provide recommendations on points of consensus, identify open questions, and highlight areas of ongoing debate in the service of moving the field toward standardized reporting of network neuroscience results'] metrics={} datasets=[] conditions=['developing a taxonomy of its fundamental explanatory constructs', 'minimal reporting guidelines for the cognitive and network neuroscience communities to adopt', 'of terminology', 'of the brain', 'of network affiliations of subcortical structures', 'of multimodal information'] confidence=0.6 limitations=['Network neuroscience, at the level of macroscale organization of the brain, is beginning to confront the challenges associated with developing a taxonomy of its fundamental explanatory constructs', 'This perspective piece includes a selective review of challenges to this enterprise, including (1) network scale, resolution, and hierarchies; (2) interindividual variability of networks; (3) dynamics and nonstationarity of networks; (4) consideration of network affiliations of subcortical structures; and (5) consideration of multimodal information'] metadata={}

id='10_1109_TNSM_2022_3213370_abstract_112_1769839751.44541' statement='In this state-of-the-art review, we integrated blockchain and AI/ML with UAV networks utilizing the 6G ecosystem' paper_id='10_1109_TNSM_2022_3213370' evidence=['In this state-of-the-art review, we integrated blockchain and AI/ML with UAV networks utilizing the 6G ecosystem'] metrics={} datasets=[] conditions=['UAV networks utilizing the 6G ecosystem', '(5G) cellular networks have led to the implementation of beyond 5G (B5G) networks', 'the one hand', 'the other hand', 'new enabling technologies such as air interface and transmission technologies', 'the security and privacy', 'future research in this emerging field of research'] confidence=0.6 limitations=['They provide capacity expansion strategies to address massive connectivity issues and guarantee ultra-high throughput and low latency, especially in extreme or emergency situations where network density, bandwidth, and traffic patterns fluctuate', '6G networks, on the other hand, rely on new enabling technologies such as air interface and transmission technologies, as well as a unique network design, posing new challenges for the swarm of UAVs', 'Keeping these challenges in mind, this article focuses on the security and privacy, intelligence, and energy-efficiency issues faced by swarms of UAVs operating in 6G mobile network', 'The key findings are then presented, and potential research challenges are identified'] metadata={}

id='10_1109_NOMS54207_2022_9789878_abstract_206_1769839751.44641' statement='To the best of our knowledge, our proposal is the first successful, practical, and extensively evaluated approach of applying GNNs on the problem of network intrusion detection for IoT using flow-based data' paper_id='10_1109_NOMS54207_2022_9789878' evidence=['To the best of our knowledge, our proposal is the first successful, practical, and extensively evaluated approach of applying GNNs on the problem of network intrusion detection for IoT using flow-based data'] metrics={} datasets=[] conditions=['flow-based data', 'Detection System (NIDS) based on Graph Neural Networks (GNNs)', 'data for NIDSs are typically represented as flow records', 'for network intrusion detection in IoT networks', 'the problem of network intrusion detection for IoT using flow-based data', 'detection', 'for further research'] confidence=0.6 limitations=[] metadata={}
